author: kevaundray
content:
Oh thats interesting, we should discuss this more. It may be help in the context of batch inserts; the current code inserts in two stages:

1. Get the "trace" of the insert; ie we create instructions that tell us all we need in order to insert into the tree
2. Execute the trace; this is the step that does the insertion and modifies the database.

For step 1, it is possible to be sped up with threading. It was what the KZG version of the code was doing.

It was also removing any extra work needed before touching the database. So if a state went from x -> y - > z , it would cut out y and just compute the diff between x and z for example
